text.more:
Thematic categories as described in the paper: 
Category 1: Students’ mathematical modeling of physical phenomena.
Category 2: Role of mathematics in physics teaching.
Category 3: Mathematics as a representation for physics.
Category 4: Students’ understanding/interpretation of mathematical concepts in physics contexts.
Category 5: Statistical analyses of relations between mathematics and physics achievement.
Category 6: Conceptions about the relationship of mathematics and physics.
Category 7: Historical and philosophical accounts of the role of mathematics in physics.
Category 8: Use of mathematics in physics problem solving.

text.intro:
A network map with context codes (n = 9), articles (n = 122), and links between articles and context codes (n = 156). Numbers refer to each article’s number (see the Supplemental Material [157]). Size of nodes is proportional to the number of the node’s connections. Colors indicate the thematic category assigned to each article.
Click on nodes to see connections. Click on article nodes to get more information about the study.
